title: 114_hr4222
content:
The Act titled "Higher Education Savings Accounts Act of 2015" includes a pilot program for Higher Education Pledge Accounts. The Secretary will establish higher education pledge accounts for eligible students in a pilot program. Eligible students must be in 9th or 10th grade and qualify for free or reduced-price lunches. Selection of participants will be based on criteria determined by the Secretary. Initial deposits will be made into the accounts. The Secretary will deposit an initial amount into each higher education pledge account, equal to the maximum Federal Pell Grant. Additional deposits may be made based on the student's academic progress. The higher education pledge account requires an initial deposit equal to the maximum Federal Pell Grant, with subsequent deposits not less than the maximum Pell Grant amount. Funds can only be used for qualified institution expenses, and the account is tax-exempt. The higher education pledge account is tax-exempt under the Internal Revenue Code of 1986. Contributions and distributions to the account are not included in gross income. Federal Pell Grants awarded to students at qualified institutions are reduced by the amount in their pledge account. The Secretary is responsible for monitoring academic progress. The Secretary monitors academic progress and ensures students receive financial counseling for their higher education pledge account. The curr_chunk is a section titled "SEC. 3. DEFINITIONS." SEC. 3. DEFINITIONS:
(1) Cost of attendance refers to the expenses outlined in the Higher Education Act of 1965.
(2) Federal financial assistance includes grants, loans, or aid under the Higher Education Act of 1965.
(3) Institution of higher education is defined as per the Higher Education Act of 1965, excluding proprietary institutions.
(4) Qualified institution is an eligible higher education institution. An institution of higher education is defined as having a program participation agreement under the Higher Education Act of 1965 and being eligible for programs under title IV of the Act. A secondary school is defined as per the Elementary and Secondary Education Act of 1965. The Secretary refers to the Secretary of Education.
